result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance P. Driscoll Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
75 days credit, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:35 PM
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Attorney Alex Gelhar - present.
Defendant - present in court - in custody.
PLQ on file.
NC plea entered to Ct. #1.
Court questions def. and advises of rights.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis for his plea contained in the probable cause section of the criminal complaint.
Def. acknowledges prior conviction.
Court finds def. guilty.
State is in compliance with victim witness notifications.
Recommendations by ADA Kurczewski.
Stmts by Atty. Gelhar.
Stmts by ADA Kurczewski.
Recommendations by Atty. Gelhar.
Court sentences def. to probation (SW) for 2 years, with the following conditions:
 1 - Defendant shall pay costs of the action, plus the $86.09 restitution surcharge..
 2 - Defendant shall pay supervision fees.
 3 - Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $860.92 to Fleet Farm. 
 4 - Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
 5 - Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
 6 - Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Def. has 75 days credit, if revoked.
Def. to meet with P&P by close of business 8/16/2022.
Court advises def. of appeal rights, firearm warning, and voter restrictions.

Bond Terminated Slip
